alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 12:01PM EDT until May 02 at 6:27AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Maine... Pemigewasset River At Woodstock affecting Grafton County. Pemigewasset River At Plymouth affecting Belknap and Grafton Counties. Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Oxford and Carroll Counties. Presumpscot River At West Falmouth affecting Cumberland County. Swift River At Roxbury affecting Oxford County. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Merrimack and Belknap Counties. For the Pemigewasset River...including Woodstock, Plymouth...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Saco River...including Conway, West Buxton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Presumpscot River...including West Falmouth...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Swift River...including Roxbury...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Presumpscot River at West Falmouth. * WHEN...From Monday morning to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, River comes out of its banks and floods portions of Fraser Field. High flows make recreational activities hazardous. At 14.0 feet, Water approaches the backyards of properties along Water Street in Westbrook and Riverside Street in Portland. At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding affects storage yards of industrial businesses on Warren Avenue in Westbrook. Property should be relocated to places which are 5 feet higher than nearby river banks to avoid being flooded or isolated. At 16.0 feet, Minor flooding with water encroaching upon East Bridge Street in Westbrook and Route 302. Riverbank Park in Westbrook floods. Sappi Wastewater Drive access cut off by floodwaters. At 21.0 feet, Flooding along Route 302 and East Bridge Street in Westbrook. Water Street flooded near Mentor Street with residential properties impacted. At 22.0 feet, Forest Avenue in Portland and Bridgton Road in Westbrook cut off by floodwaters. Water up to properties along River Street in Westbrook. The flood level is comparable to that of Hurricane Bob in 1991. At 23.0 feet, Backwater from Mill Brook floods properties off Forest Avenue and East Bridge Street in Westbrook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 4.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 20.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
